summary: This is a prepared press release by the FBI New York Field Office announcing the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein on sex trafficking and conspiracy charges. It alleges he exploited dozens of minor girls from 2002-2005 at his homes in New York and Florida, using recruiters, and calls for additional victims to come forward.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Arrested and charged with one count each of sex trafficking and sex trafficking conspiracy for allegedly sexually exploiting and abusing dozens of minor girls from 2002-2005.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by the FBI and charged with one count of sex trafficking and one count of sex trafficking conspiracy.

events.title: Start of alleged trafficking period
events.description: The beginning of the alleged period (2002-2005) during which Jeffrey Epstein sexually exploited and abused dozens of minor girls.

events.title: End of alleged trafficking period
events.description: The end of the alleged period (2002-2005) during which Jeffrey Epstein sexually exploited and abused dozens of minor girls.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and charged with sex trafficking and sex trafficking conspiracy in July 2019.
The charges allege he sexually exploited and abused dozens of minor girls, some as young as 14, from 2002 to 2005.
The alleged abuse occurred at his homes in New York City and Palm Beach, Florida.
Girls were reportedly recruited by Epstein's employees and other victim recruiters, who were paid hundreds of dollars in cash.
The FBI publicly called for additional victims or witnesses to come forward, providing a hotline number (1-800-CALL-FBI).
